column4: My power went out today, when I rebooted my ubuntu machine I cannot connect to my mpd server, my samba server, or open ssh, the Ip is the same and grabbed via dhcp, any ideas?
try setting a static ip and rebooting it
are all those servers separate machines? or where are they all running?
what os are you using to try to connect to it?
and on winxp and its just not working
I have one machine that runs mpd, samba and openssh, its ubuntu 9.10
is this the first time you've had issues after rebooting? have you tried rebooting once?
yea never had problems before today
how are you verifying what IP ubuntu has?
I can ping out from the server to google etc and ifconfig -a shows it as being the right ip
have you tried restarting the server?
do you have any other computers running ubuntu besides the server you can use?
home servers should have static IPs set, for the record avoids issues down the line.
